result.execSummary:
The defendant Steven A Jones was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: APPLY BAIL. Costs and DNA PAID IN FULL.
Maintain full time employment and/or school.
Submit to an AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended.

Maintain absolute sobriety.
Submit to random alcohol/drug screens.
Not to use or possess of alcohol or controlled substances without a valid prescription or any drug paraphernalia.
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of all prescriptions.
All prescriptions to be filled through the same pharmacy.
Inform any treatment physicians of the court cases.
Follow through with any treatment/counseling recommended.
Provide DNA sample if not already provided.
No association with known drug users or dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged or distributed.
No violent contact with victim.

Plea/sentencing hearing on February 9, 2017 at 02:00 pm.

Defendant Steven A Jones in court with attorney Adam J. Schleis.  Michael Thurston appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense has not been able to receive a global offer from the State and requests adjournment.  State does not object.  Court grants.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for February 9, 2017 at 02:00 pm.
Plea/sentencing hearing on December 9, 2016 at 09:30 am.

Defendant Steven A Jones in court with attorney Paul Crawford for Adam J. Schleis.  Kristi J Gordon appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant counsel is requesting plea and sentencing date sometime in December for his client to complete his treatment. Court grants.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for December 9, 2016 at 09:30 am.
Hearing on October 5, 2016 at 10:30 am.
Defendant Steven A Jones in court with attorney Adam J. Schleis.  Ted Szczupakiewicz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.  Hearing scheduled for October 5, 2016 at 10:30 am.
Hearing on September 2, 2016 at 08:15 am.

Letter dated 8/1/2016 requesting adjournment filed by defendant/defense counsel.
Matter reviewed by Commissioner Robert Dehring Jr. on 8/3/2016 granting request for adjournment.
Hearing on August 5, 2016 at 03:00 pm.

Defendant Steven A Jones in court, in custody, with attorney Adam J. Schleis.   Abbey Nickolie appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense counsel is requesting adjournment has pick-up another felony charge and defense counsel would like to make a global offer as to all matters. Defense counsel presents bail arguments. State objects to any modification. Court denied the motion. Bail remains as fixed.  Hearing scheduled for August 5, 2016 at 03:00 pm.
Plea/sentencing hearing on June 29, 2016 at 09:00 am.

Attorney Adam J. Schleis in court.   Defendant Steven A Jones did not appear.   Brian J. Juech appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense counsel is requesting plea and sentencing date. Court grants.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for June 29, 2016 at 09:00 am.
Hearing at 04-18-2016 01:30 pm

Defendant Steven A Jones in court with attorney Adam J. Schleis.  Pablo Galaviz appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense counsel is requesting adjournment as he is working on resolving this matter. Court grants.  Hearing scheduled for April 18, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
Hearing at 02-17-2016 09:00 am

Defendant to have no contact with victim/witness/residence listed in the Criminal Complaint.  Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed. Contact Sheriff's Department with current address.
